title: Contract for Roslindale Square Transportation Plan

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Contract for Roslindale Square Transportation Plan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Whom It May Concern:
A Request for Proposals was issued titled “Roslindale and Maverick Squares Transportation Action Plan and Design, Boston Transportation Department, Nicolos Gove EV00014797.” 
I hereby request the following records in regard to this contract, that pertain to data gathering, analysis, and community engagement conducted for Roslindale Square by the Open Box, Bowman Consulting Group, KMDG, the Boston Transportation Department and any others whose work is covered by this contract since January 1, 2024:
I -Reports and Deliverables
A. Any reports, including but not limited to:
1. Survey instruments, responses, and tabulated data summaries
2. Interim or final reports
3. Memos
4. Slide presentations
5. Findings prepared by Open Box, BTD, or other consultants related to Roslindale Square
II - Public Participation Records
A. All materials and data associated with public engagement efforts, including but not limited to:
1. Invitations, flyers, agendas, meeting minutes, slide decks, recordings, and handouts
2. Screening criteria and methods
3. Focus group interview guide
4. Individual interview guide
5. Number of individual participants and how identified
6. Number of organizational participants and how identified
7. Demographic breakdowns of participants (where collected), including but not limited to:
a. Age
b. Race/ethnicity
c. Language
d. Neighborhood
e. Whether or not a business owner, and business information including but not limited to:
i. Type of business
ii. Business address
iii. Duration of business presence in Roslindale Square
8. Survey or feedback responses categorized by:
a. Demographic information
b. Geographic information
c. Roslindale Business Owner status (yes/no)
III - Methods used to ensure equitable outreach and engagement
IV - Organizational Participation
A. Records identifying organizations that participated in public engagement or stakeholder processes, including but not limited to:
1. Organization names, number of representatives involved, and event dates
2. Role or type of participation (focus group, listening session, steering committee, etc.)
3. Contact person (name, title, email) for each participating organization (where available)
4. Any formal or informal feedback or written submissions provided by these organizations
V - Correspondence
A. Email or written correspondence between BTD staff (including Directors), Chief of Streets, Open Box, Roslindale Village Main Streets, WalkUP Roslindale, Abundant Housing, Rozzidents for More Rozzidents, including but not limited to: Anna VanRemoortel, Laura Charles, Emma Blaxter, Alyssa MacNeill, Courtney Pong, Matthew Lawlor, Benjamin Bruno, Andrew Murray, Nate Stell, Elvira Moira or others regarding Roslindale Square, particularly where engagement methods, community data, or equity analysis were discuss
Consultant Engagement and Contracts
A. All contracts, scopes of work, MOUs, RFQs, and procurement documentation relating to the engagement of Open Box or other external consultants for work on the Roslindale Square assessment
VI -Data Collection and Analysis
A. All raw and processed data collected on transportation, traffic, pedestrian movement, parking, public space use, and effects on small businesses in Roslindale Square, including but not limited to:
1. Camera footage, sensor logs, pedestrian/vehicle counts, and associated metadata
2. GIS files, maps, and visualizations (e.g., heat maps, mobility models)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rosaline Russ

title: Martoiya Lang shooting / Shelby

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Martoiya Lang shooting / Shelby
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records concerning the December 14, 2012 shooting death of Memphis Police Officer Martoiya Lang, who was killed while executing a narcotics search warrant as part of the Memphis Police Department’s Organized Crime Unit.

Specifically, I am requesting the following:

Case files related to the prosecution of Treveno Campbell (or any other individuals) charged in connection with the death of Officer Martoiya Lang.


Charging documents, indictments, arrest affidavits, plea agreements, and sentencing records related to the case.


Any prosecutorial memos, internal notes, or correspondence regarding charging decisions, plea negotiations, or trial strategy.


Court filings, including motions, hearing transcripts, trial transcripts, and sentencing transcripts (if available).


Victim impact statements or correspondence submitted by Officer Lang’s family or representatives during the prosecutorial process.


Internal communications or memoranda between the Shelby County District Attorney’s Office and the Memphis Police Department (or other agencies) regarding the investigation and prosecution.


Press releases, public statements, or summaries prepared by your office about the case.


I would like my above request to be filled in electronic formats (such as .pdf or similar format) whenever possible, and if the formats are readily available.
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of policing tactics in Memphis. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 

I request that all future communication be conducted via email or phone call. Whenever possible, I would like the documents that are responsive to my request to be filled through email as well.


I also request a prompt response to this request. State law requires a seven-business-day response time. If you expect a significant delay in responding to or fulfilling this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.


Public records in Tennessee are defined as “all documents, papers, letters, maps, books, photographs, microfilms, electronic data processing files and output, films, sound recordings, or other material, regardless of physical form or characteristics, made or received pursuant to law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by any governmental entity.” Tenn. Code Ann. § 10-7-503(a)(1)(A)(i).


If you deny any or all of these requests, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.


Thank you for considering my request and please feel free to reach out to me if any part of this request needs to be clarified. I am open to modifying my request to facilitate a response in a way that is more amenable for the department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Josiah Bates.

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Martoiya Lang shooting / Shelby - Treveno Campbell, AG#AV6197, Ind#13 03166
communications.communication:
This Office has received the referenced Public Records request.  Regrettably, this request is denied for the following reasons:
(a)   Records of this Office are available for inspection and copying to citizens of Tennessee.  Your request fails to include proof of Tennessee citizenship.
(b)   The records requested are related to a pending Petition on Error Corum Nobis, a collateral attack upon the conviction.  These records are not available for inspection and copying as Public Records during the pendency of this matter.

If this Office may be of further assistance with a Public Records matter, please contact this Desk.
Respectfully,
Timothy A. Beacham
Assistant District Attorney General
Public Records Counsel and Request Coordinator
Shelby County District Attorney General’s Office
201 Poplar Avenue, Ste. 11000
Memphis, Tennessee 38103
(901) 222-1300/-1493
(901) 222-7971 (fax)
PublicRecords@scdag.com<mailto:PublicRecords@scdag.com>

This electronic mail may be subject to the Tennessee Public Records Act, Tenn. Code Ann. §10-7-503, et seq.  Any reply to this email may also be subject to this Act.

title: FOIL Request for Records Related to Case #09-7493 CF

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Records Related to Case #09-7493 CF
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All records held by the New York City Police Department at 1 Police Plaza related to the missing person case of Leanne Marie Hausberg (Case Number: 09-7493 CF, missing March 18, 1999, from Brooklyn, NY; DOB: August 9, 1984). Specifically, I seek:

1) All non-exempt investigative records, including but not limited to incident reports, follow-up reports, witness statements, and case summaries, held at 1 Police Plaza.
2) A copy Leanne Hausberg's diary, which is located at One Police Plaza, as confirmed to me by former NYPD detective John Ferriso.
3) General NYPD policies, procedures, or training manuals for handling missing persons cases in 1999, particularly for minors and Indigenous persons, to understand investigative protocols.
4)Any inter-agency communications (e.g., with the FBI or Kings County DA) related to Case #09-7493 CF, redacted as needed to protect privacy.

I understand that certain records may be exempt under POL § 87(2), such as those interfering with an ongoing investigation (POL § 87(2)(e)(i)), personal privacy (POL § 87(2)(b)), or medical/DNA information (POL § 87(2)(a)). However, given that this case is over 26 years old with no publicly reported developments since 1999, it likely has no active leads, and thus disclosure would not interfere with an ongoing investigation, as exemptions cease when investigations conclude (Lesher v. Hynes, 19 NY3d 57, 2012). I request that any exempt portions be redacted and that all segregable, non-exempt records be released, as required by Gould v. NYC Police Dep’t (89 N.Y.2d 267). 

If no additional records exist beyond the initial complaint report provided to me on July 9, 2025, please confirm this in writing.


PLEASE NOTE: This request is made in the public interest to understand NYPD’s handling of missing minors’ cases, as highlighted by media coverage (e.g., ABC7’s “Missing” series) and also to understand the NYPD's handling of the Missing and Murdered Indigenous People crisis, as Leanne Hausberg (Birth Name: Leanne Marie Billie) was half-Native American.

Please contact me at sarahaziz822@gmail.com or (929) 752-2814 for correspondence. 

Thank you very much for your attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Aziz

If no additional records exist beyond the initial complaint report provided to me on July 9, 2025, please confirm this in writing.

PLEASE NOTE: This request is made in the public interest to understand NYPD’s handling of missing minors’ cases, as highlighted by media coverage (e.g., ABC7’s “Missing” series) and also to understand the NYPD's handling of the Missing and Murdered Indigenous People crisis, as Leanne Hausberg (Birth Name: Leanne Marie Billie) was half-Native American.

Please contact me at sarahaziz822@gmail.com or (929) 752-2814 for correspondence.

Thank you very much for your attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Aziz

title: Thomas Perez Jr. Interrogation footage and documents

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Thomas Perez Jr. Interrogation footage and documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to the following public records related to the 17 hours interrogation and investigation of Thomas Perez Jr., which occurred on 8th August 2018, conducted by the Fontana Police Department: On the evening of August 7, 2018, Thomas Perez Sr. left his home in Fontana, California, to walk the family dog to get the mail. The dog returned alone, but Perez Sr. did not. The next day, August 8, 2018, his son, Thomas Perez Jr., called the Fontana Police Department to report his father missing. Perez Jr. was taken to the police station and subjected to a 17-hour, high-pressure interrogation which resulted in a false confession. 

Requested Records:

1. Video or audio recordings of the interrogation(s) of Thomas Perez Jr.


2. Transcripts of said interrogation(s), if available.


3. Body camera footage and 911 recordings associated with this incident.


4. Police reports, investigative summaries, and any written statements or notes filed by officers involved.


5. Any internal review, complaint, or disciplinary records related to the handling of this case.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brown Pearl

title: Thomas Andrew Lehrer (April 9, 1928 – July 26, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Thomas Andrew Lehrer (April 9, 1928 – July 26, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into musician Thomas Andrew Lehrer (April 9, 1928 – July 26, 2025) . His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/07/27/arts/music/tom-lehrer-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Cape Coral Public Records Request – Records Requests Log

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cape Coral Public Records Request – Records Requests Log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Custodian:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, I request access to records showing public records requests received by your agency during the period Jan 1 2025  through date request fulfilled. Specifically, please provide:

A log, spreadsheet, database, or summary (electronic or otherwise) of all public records requests received;

-For each request: the date received, requester’s name , summary of the request, assigned tracking number (if any), and status or final disposition (e.g. fulfilled, denied, pending);

-Any reports, internal summaries, or aggregated data your agency compiles related to public records request volume.

Please produce the records in a machine‑readable format (e.g. CSV or Excel) if available. 

Thank you for your prompt attention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: FBI: Fresno Mayor Dale Doig

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Fresno Mayor Dale Doig
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau documents related to the former Mayor of Fresno DALE DOIG (born July 24, 1935 - February 10th, 2022). Doig's death was widely reported in the media and a copy of his obituary is attached. 

https://www.fresnobee.com/news/local/article258578908.html

Please search for any FD-302 forms generated from bureau questioning of DOIG. Any FD-302 form of DOIG would have likely been created in relation to the FBI's Operation REZONE (FILE NUMBER 194B-SC-23790) investigation into Fresno real estate practices. 

This is a request for records about DALE DOIG from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on DOIG by the Sacramento and Fresno field offices. Please search for any correspondence to or from DOIG by either Director William Webster or William Sessions. 

According to a blog post read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, the Federal Bureau of Investigation is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under the FBI’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to DALE DOIG.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to DALE DOIG.

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the bureau's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Untitled (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Benefits Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request applies broadly to all contractors utilized by VA to perform disability medical examinations, including but not limited to Veterans Evaluation Services (VES), QTC Medical Services, Logistics Health Incorporated (LHI), and any other contractor or subcontractor operating under VA authority for this purpose.

For the period FY2023 to the present, I request the following records:

List of Contractors: A list of all entities contracted to perform C&P examinations, including contract numbers, effective dates, and scope of services.

Total Contractor Payments: Annual dollar amounts paid to each contractor during the specified period, broken down by fiscal year.

Cost per Examination:

Any documentation showing average cost per examination, broken down by type of exam (e.g., general medical, mental health, musculoskeletal, TBI, Gulf War, audiology, etc.).

Any cost matrix or price schedule showing negotiated or standard rates paid per exam type under each contract.

Any documentation explaining pricing adjustments for travel, expedited scheduling, or exam revisions.

Payment Policies for Inadequate Exams:

Any contract provisions, policy guidance, or internal memos addressing whether and when VA pays contractors for examinations that are later deemed inadequate, noncompliant, or returned for correction.

Documentation clarifying whether such exams are subject to reimbursement, penalty, or payment denial under contract terms.

Quality Assurance and Oversight:

Internal audit reports, performance evaluations, or compliance reviews of contracted C&P examinations.

Records showing error rates, rates of returned exams, or other quality control metrics used to assess contractor performance.

Any internal guidance or SOPs related to the review, correction, or rejection of contractor exams.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gary

title: Jim Osgood

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jim Osgood
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to James Bradshaw Osgood. He was born on 6 April 1932 in New Castle, Pennsylvania, USA and died on 25 December 2004.

OTHER NAMES USED

Osgood sometimes used the alias Jim Bradford. Please include that name in your search.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Osgood was the past president of Mattachine Midwest, a gay rights organization based in Chicago.

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Osgood's obituary from the Windy City Times.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH 

Please conduct a cross-reference search of the FBI’s records for the following organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Osgood: (1) Mattachine Midwest (2) Mattachine Society.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

title: IRB Noncomplaince VCU

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IRB Noncomplaince VCU
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records are related to the Office for Human Research Protections’ (OHRP) investigation of Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU), as referenced in the publicly posted March 12, 2025 determination letter authored by Crystal M. Kelly, MPH.

I request the following:

All correspondence between OHRP and VCU from May 1, 2022 through March 31, 2025 concerning this investigation.

All documents submitted by VCU in response to OHRP’s inquiries, including but not limited to:

IRB records and meeting minutes

Post-Approval Monitoring and Quality Improvement Program (PAMQuiP) reports

Audit or investigation reports

Institutional responses dated May 23, 2022; September 12, 2022; March 9, 2023; and May 16, 2023

A list of the IRB protocols reviewed during the June 2022 OHRP site visit.

The name(s) of the principal investigator(s) whose studies were reviewed during this investigation, or a justification if this information is withheld under FOIA exemptions.

Please provide the materials electronically. If any portion of the documents are withheld, I request a redacted version with a Vaughn index citing the applicable exemptions.

Thank you for your attention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned Researcher

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

communications.subject: Wyoming Public Records Act Request: wyoming board license list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Complete Current Licensee Database
A comprehensive list of all currently licensed medical professionals in Wyoming, including:

Physicians (MD)
Doctors of Osteopathic Medicine (DO)
Physician Assistants (PA)
Any other medical professionals under Board jurisdiction

For each licensee, please provide:

License number
Full name
License type/designation
Current license status
Initial license date
License expiration date

2. Disciplinary Action Records
For each current licensee listed above, please indicate:

Whether any disciplinary action has ever been taken by the Board
Type of disciplinary action(s) taken (if any)
Date(s) of disciplinary action(s)
Case/docket numbers for disciplinary proceedings
Current status of any ongoing disciplinary matters

Clarification and Scope

This request seeks only records pertaining to current, active licensees
All requested information constitutes public records under Wyoming law
Disciplinary actions are already publicly disclosed on the Board's website; this request seeks the same information in a comprehensive, searchable format
No protected health information or confidential records are being requested
Personal contact information (addresses, phone numbers) may be redacted if deemed necessary

Format and Delivery
I would prefer to receive these records electronically via email attachment in Excel or CSV format if possible, or on CD-ROM if electronic delivery is not available.
In the event that there are fees associated with this request, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

title: David Gergen

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Gergen
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to David Richmond Gergen. He was born on 9 May 1942 in Durham, North Carolina, USA and died on 10 July 2025.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

David Gergen was a Washington, D.C. political insider who served in four presidential administrations. 

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Gergen's obituary from the Associated Press.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All video, including but not limited to bodycam, dashcam, drone footage, stationary surveillance, and real-time crime center footage of the protest, riot, demonstration, vigil, march, alleged civil unreset, alleged unlawful assembly, and use of force incident on the Robeling Bridge on July 17, 2025. 
- All emails, reports, memorandums, letters, statements (including, but not limited to those from officers, witnesses, victims, and anyone charged with a crime in relationship with the event), text messages, taser logs, CAD log, citations, arrested reports, out-briefing, after action report, related to the protest, riot, demonstration, vigil, march, alleged civil unreset, alleged unlawful assembly, and use of force incident on the Robeling Bridge on July 17, 2025 on the Robeling Bridge on July 17, 2025.
- All office of internal affairs or human resources emails, reports, memorandums, letters, statements, investigations, agreements related to the protest, riot, demonstration, vigil, march, alleged civil unreset, alleged unlawful assembly, and use of force incident on the Robeling Bridge on July 17, 2025 on the Robeling Bridge on July 17, 2025.

The incident is referenced in these news reports:
https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=2160075287833562
https://www.cincinnati.com/story/news/2025/07/19/covington-police-response-roebling-bridge-protest/85283594007/
https://www.covingtonky.gov/news/2025/07/19/mayor-and-police-chief-hold-press-conference-after-incident-on-the-roebling-bridge

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lara S Nochomovitz

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City of San Antonio)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise
